content.html:
Excellent post from @timbray on Mastodonia's dislike of algorithms

"So let’s stop saying “No algorithms!” because that’s just wrong, and figure out how to get nice algorithms built, ones that primarily are there to serve humanity’s best interests."

https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2022/11/28/On-Algorithms
content.value: Excellent post from @timbray on Mastodonia's dislike of algorithms "So let’s stop saying “No algorithms!” because that’s just wrong, and figure out how to get nice algorithms built, ones that primarily are there to serve humanity’s best interests."https://www.tbray.org/ongoing/When/202x/2022/11/28/On-Algorithms

content.html:
I just had a realisation about #Autism diagnostic criteria. I suspect this applies to other #disabilities too.

It's largely a collection of the reasons others don't like us.

That's why in many cases if a medical practitioner sees things about you they do like, they withhold diagnosis. For example, if they perceive you as attractive, intelligent, funny, approachable, i.e. to them, likeable.

It's straight #ableism : "You can't be disabled, because I like you, and I don't like disabled people."
content.value: I just had a realisation about #Autism diagnostic criteria. I suspect this applies to other #disabilities too.It's largely a collection of the reasons others don't like us.That's why in many cases if a medical practitioner sees things about you they do like, they withhold diagnosis. content.html: What I'm saying is that there's only one creative team that has repeatedly demonstrated the ability to produce adaptations of literary classics. And that's why The Muppets should have been allowed to make the Dune movie.

content.html:
Today as you injest your stimulant to recover from last night's run on the megacorp, jacking in to the warm glow of pixels being flung at your mirror-shade covered eyes,

Try to remember the true meaning of Cyber Monday.

content.html: the spiral labyrinth seems to be working! i was a little worried, the tuning of this one is /extremely/ delicate and last time i tried to refactor one of these it didn't feel the same afterward. left is original, right is refactored.

content.html: Maybe it's better to just ask more directly: Which orientation of hex grid do you prefer/find easier to use when looking things up on maps?
content.value: Maybe it's better to just ask more directly: Which orientation of hex grid do you prefer/find easier to use when looking things up on maps?

content.html: When you look up an item on a grid, given a numerical index eg(X,Y), do you search horizontally for the correct column before finding the row, or vertically to find the right row and then horizontally for the correct column?
content.value: When you look up an item on a grid, given a numerical index eg(X,Y), do you search horizontally for the correct column before finding the row, or vertically to find the right row and then horizontally for the correct column?

content.html: Accessibility friends. If the alt text on an image isn't really adding much, ie describing non-interactive UI elements is it better to just remove it? Ie if I've got an avatar image next to a person's name, is it better to mark that up with an alt text that says "such and such's avatar" to give as much information as possible or is it better to just leave it out cause their name is the next thing anyway?
content.value: Accessibility friends. If the alt text on an image isn't really adding much, ie describing non-interactive UI elements is it better to just remove it? Ie if I've got an avatar image next to a person's name, is it better to mark that up with an alt text that says "such and such's avatar" to give as much information as possible or is it better to just leave it out cause their name is the next thing anyway?
